title: GENERAL
fullText:
After the electrical installation has been completed and before the boat is placed in commission, the entire electrical installation shall be verified by inspection and testing in accordance with AS/NZS 3000. Such tests are intended to indicate the general condition of the installation at the time of completion; however, satisfactory test results do not in themselves necessarily ensure that the installation is satisfactory in all respects. Appendix C provides guidance on periodic verification.
NOTE: The test methods described by AS/NZS 3000 and AS/NZS 3017 will in some instances need to be adapted to effectively test a boat's electrical installation.
All the switches and isolators necessary for the safe use of the installation and for the safe performance of control and electrical work shall be present during testing.
A record of the tests and inspections carried out shall be made in accordance with Appendix C.
In New Zealand, a Warrant of Electrical Fitness (WoEF) shall only be issued for a boat that has been inspected and tested in accordance with Appendix C. The WoEF shall be certified on an appropriate form. See Appendix D.
